Network Security Engineer
description: Job Code: 16292878 Job Location: Naval Air Station Oceana Dam Neck, Virginia Beach Imagine One is currently seeking qualified Network Security Engineer III individuals to join our team to provide Network Security Engineering Support to Naval Surface Warfare Center Dahlgren Division, Dam Neck who supports the Program Executive Office Unmanned and Small Combatants (PEO) providing cybersecurity engineering support, cybersecurity requirements Software Support Activity support for the Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) class Environment (TSCE) networks, LCS Afloat Sites for PMS 501 (New Construction), Service), and IWS80 Littoral Combat Ships( LCS). Work will be on-site at Naval Air Station Oceana Dam Neck, Virginia Beach, Virginia with 25 percent travel potential. The Network Security Engineer III will provide ongoing network support, addresses availability issues, overcome performance problems, and provide overall level 2 support. Designs, installs, maintains and coordinates the use of network systems. Evaluates hardware and software and peripheral equipment for large, complex networks to include the following responsibilities: Responsibilities for Network Security Engineer III: The Network Security Engineer III would serve as a Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) Network Security Engineer at NSWCDD DNA. The Network Security Engineer III will provide network-engineering support to pre-delivery and in-service LCS ships. The selectee will serve within a team of engineers for the LCS Total Ships Computing Environment (TSCE) core business network and provide support for the LCS Software Support Agent (SSA). He/she will perform network engineering, integration, evaluation and testing within the LCS TSCE core business network. He/she will perform networks security updates upgrades to ensure the security and integrity of the TSCE network. Network Security Engineer III will analyze, troubleshoot and resolve issues with the LCS TSCE infrastructure including devices such as routers, switches, and firewalls. The Network Security Engineer III will perform all duties associated for support, maintenance, performance and uptime of the LCS TSCE core infrastructure to include as follows: Provide network security engineering support to PMS 501/505 and IWS80 for implementation of Cybersecurity Ships Change Documents (SCDs) and Engineering Change Proposal (ECPs). Provide engineering and network architecture expertise for pre-delivery/in-service ships for integration and modernization efforts. Perform security/vulnerability assessments using DoD provided tools; reporting results to the lead cybersecurity system engineer. Provide oversight for the day-to-day management and maintenance of the LCS core network infrastructure. Perform firewall and network device support for the TSCE core infrastructure. Oversee in the deployment of switches, routers, firewalls, and storage devices from multiple vendors. Support and interact with the network cybersecurity engineers, system administrators, and system engineers to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of systems, networks, and data. Assist with network engineering executing activities such as the design, implementation, installation, configuration, maintenance, integration, and analysis. Assist in the management and maintenance of lab facilities. Apply software patches and patch sets during maintenance windows Includes operating system (OS) patches released from DISA’s patch repository website. Upgrade software. Conduct regression testing Required Qualifications Requires five (5) years with BS/BA or minimum zero (0) to two (2) years with MS/MA/MBA or eight to ten (8 to 10) years with no degree. Minimum certification as 461 at the Intermediate level per DoDD 8140.01, or successor Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II certification Minimum of five (5) years’ experience in Network Engineering Demonstrated experience with Windows OS and Linux OS Demonstrated experience with performing STIG implementation Demonstrated experience performing vulnerability assessments with the Assured Compliance Assessment Solution tool Must have hands-on technical experience in the following areas: Network Routing Protocols Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Firewalls Extensive experience with Access Control Lists (ACLs) Experience with Cisco security devices focusing on Identity Services Engine (ISE), Web Security Appliance (WSA) and Email Security Appliance (ESA) Demonstrated experience troubleshooting network connectivity issues Must have experience in Network Security to include the design, implementation, configuration, and enforcement of security controls on network, hardware, and software components and devices Experience with the implementation of cybersecurity and Information Assurance (IA) boundary defense techniques and various IA-enabled appliances (firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), Intrusion Prevention System (IPS), switches/routers Knowledge of computing and networking vulnerabilities, attack methods and latest detection methods Excellent ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing Preferred Qualifications: Served on a LCS platform Windows Server upgrade experience HBSS knowledge is a plus Experience utilizing packet analyzer tools such as Wireshark and tcpdump Hyper-V or VMware experience is a plus Alcatel operating system experience is a plus Security Requirements: U.S. Citizenship required. Candidate must have an ACTIVE SECRET clearance (with TS/SCI eligibility) Imagine One offers a full package of benefits and competitive salary, excellent group medical, vision and dental programs. 401K savings plan; $4K annual tuition reimbursement ($5K if pursuing Master’s degree); employee training, development and education programs; profit sharing; advancement opportunities; and much more! Imagine One is an Employee-Owned Company! EEO/AA Employer. Protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities encouraged to apply. Get job alerts by email. Sign up now! Join Our Talent Network! Job Snapshot Employee Type Full-Time Location Virginia Beach, VA (Onsite) Job Type Information Technology Experience Not Specified Date Posted 11/21/2023 Job ID 16292878

title: System Engineer
description: Role and Responsibilities: Full Time position supporting the CEC Task Order filling the associate systems engineer position with extensive travel. Duties include: system engineering, test analysis, and technical documentation support. The position is located at Virginia Beach, VA. Position Duties: Either Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or other technical degree and minimum of 1 year experience or no degree with a minimum of 5 years technical experience supporting Navy systems experience. Must have a minimum of four years hands-on CEC experience. Must provide hardware, software, interoperability, and technical reports during CEC test events. Must be able to document engineering analysis, objectives, and results. Must be able to work independently completing maintenance, troubleshooting, and operation requirements. Must be able to perform complex engineering analysis tasks including operate test equipment to perform system setup and troubleshooting. Must be able to work independently or in a team, complete tasks, and provide technical guidance to others. Must be able to take responsibility for action items assigned, complete the actions, and provide status. Must have a valid driver’s license with own transportation and able to travel (75 -90%). Must be able to satisfactorily complete background check and get a government clearance. Must be able to follow company policies and procedures. Must be able to write, speak and understand English and able to write clear, detailed technical monthly reports. Preferred Skills: Experience with radar fundamentals, circuit repair, and test equipment Experience with Link 16 Experience with Red Hat and UNIX Experience with fiber-optics Navy A / C School (FC or OS) Mandatory Physical Requirements: Must be able to climb a 400 foot tower. Must be able to lift 50 pounds

title: System Engineer
description: Peraton Overview Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can't be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Responsibilities Peraton is seeking qualified individuals to join our team to provide Cyber Systems Engineer ing Server Support to Naval Surface Warfare Center Dahlgren Division, Dam Neck, VA. You will support the Program Executive Office Unmanned and Small Combatants (PEO) providing cybersecurity engineering support, cybersecurity requirements Software Support Activity support for the Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) class Environment (TSCE) networks, LCS Afloat Sites for PMS 501 (New Construction), Service), and IWS80 Littoral Combat Ships( LCS). Are you interested to serve as a Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) Cyber Systems Engineer at NSWCDD DNA? Here are some details for your consideration, you will provide: Travel up to 25% to Ships in Ports to provide server-engineering support to pre-delivery and in-service LCS ships. Serve within a team of engineers for the LCS Total Ships Computing Environment (TSCE) core business, server and network support for the LCS Software Support Agent (SSA). Perform server systems and network engineering, integration, evaluation and testing within the LCS TSCE core business network. Perform server and security updates upgrades to ensure the security and integrity of the TSCE network. Analyze, troubleshoot and resolve issues with the LCS TSCE infrastructure. Design and transition from exiting Windows server envoirnments to upgraded server versions.. Implement DISA Security Technical Guides and manage IT systems architect across Windows environements: 2016, 2019, and VMare ESX. Conduct IT Systems backups Oversee quarterly STIGs and implement GPO STIGS released Manage user and admin accounts for Active Directory; install system updates and enhancements Modify or remove user access to network resources; monitor and/or disable inactive accounts and control permissions. Identify and remediate vulnerabilities in IT Systems using quarterly STIGS. Work with Assured Compliance Assessment Solutions (ACAS) to monitor risk assessments and vulnerabilities.. Manager Application(s) updates and install after server updates. Collaborate with other team member regarding troubleshoting systems issues. Qualifications Required 2 years with BS/BA; 0 years with MS/MA; 6 years with no degree Minimum of 6 years' experience in Systems Administration / Engineering roles STIG Server Migration experience VMware ACAS Demonstrated experience with Windows OS and ability to learn Linux OS Demonstrated experience with performing STIG implementation Demonstrated experience performing vulnerability assessments with the Assured Compliance Assessment Solution tool Ability to travel up 25% (US Sites) Minimum certification as 461 at the Intermediate level per DoDD 8140.01, or successor IAT Level II certification Current Secret or higher security clearance Travel and work location: up to 25% Travel potential On-site Dam Neck, Va. no remote work Preferred Qualifications: TS/SCI eligible security clearance Served on a LCS platform HBSS knowledge Experience utilizing packet analyzer tools such as Wireshark and tcpdump Hyper-V or VMware experience Alcatel operating system experience Target Salary Range $86,000 - $138,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors. SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range EEO An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran. Our Values Benefits At Peraton, our benefits are designed to help keep you at your best beyond the work you do with us daily. We're fully committed to the growth of our employees. From fully comprehensive medical plans to tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, and fertility treatment, we are there to support you all the way. Paid Time-Off and Holidays Retirement Life & Disability Insurance Career Development Tuition Assistance and Student Loan Financing Paid Parental Leave Additional Benefits Medical, Dental, & Vision Care

title: Systems Administrator
description: Amentum is currently seeking a Red Hat Systems Engineer to support efforts at Joint Staff in Suffolk, VA. The successful candidate will provide technical solutions and perform the required functions to support for exercise systems in accordance with DoD, Navy Maintenance Procedures, and Cyber System instructions; assist in the installation, troubleshooting and testing of the Systems; and provide support in a variety of engineering tasks in the installation, maintenance, repair, troubleshooting, testing, operation of exercise simulation systems in accordance with engineering specifications. Support systems engineering activities with Windows, RHEL, Domain Controllers, Active Directory, NFS, and VMWare. Direct on-site customer interface for equipment/systems installation, testing, survey, fabrication, and other engineering tasks as needed Provide configuration management and preventative maintenance for Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Servers (Versions 6.10 and 8.02). Security+ Excellent communications and analytical skills; Ability to work on a team but also take initiative and manage your own taskings. Must have an Active Secret US Government Clearance. Note: US Citizenship is required to maintain a Secret clearance. Must be able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI US Government Clearance. title: Network Systems Engineer
description: JOB DESCRIPTIONJob Title: Network Systems Technician, Level 3Department: Reports to: Manager of OperationsGENERAL SUMMARY:The Level 3 Network Systems Technician is responsible for providing high-level technical assistance to the help desk team. This position is responsible for third level support of service requests, including escalation of level 1 and level 2 service tickets, technology, and duties, plus advanced technical issues. The Level 3 Network Systems Technician also acts as a technical resource to the TAM and CEM teams.Duties and Responsibilities:· Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to technical difficulties with hardware, software and network via telephony, email, ticket portal or in person· Responsible for mentoring and assisting with level 1 and level 2 escalations· Drive problem investigation and resolution as required· Contribute to the continuity of computer services by providing the necessary technical leadership· Identify areas for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change· Develop training programs to develop and refine the skills of the help desk team· Write service templates, as well as Run Books, to contribute to the knowledge base· Document internal processes and procedures related to duties and responsibilities· Work with the Manager of Operations and the Help Desk Supervisor on strategic initiatives leading towards more effective methods and process with a focus on resolution times.· Assist the CEM and TAM with design and development tasks when requested· Review IT publications and online materials to remain up to date with current and future technologies emerging in the industry· Remain up to date with all certifications to ensure Best Practices are being followed.Competencies:· 5+ years of experience working on a technical support help desk· Technical writing skills with focus on training and documentation· Diagnosis skills of technical issues· Ability to positively mentor, coach and lead by example· Proactively provide first class service· Conduct one’s self with proper business ethics; treat others with respect and keep commitments· Respond promptly and professionally with prospects, customers and fellow team members· Write clearly, informatively, and completely on all tickets and customer communications· Speak clearly and persuasively. Listen and probe openly and patiently and get clarification· Ability to handle and problem solve issues without direction· Must be able to be flexible with regards to schedule· Ability to complete multiple simultaneous projects in a timely manor· Have a high level of integrity and morale· Be presentable at all times as you represent Onepath at all timesKnowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities Required: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.· 5+ years working on a professional help desk team with at least 2 years in a level 2 position· Professional IT Certifications, such as: Microsoft MCSE, Cisco CCNP, and/or MVWare VCP· Advanced understanding of operating systems, business applications, networking, printing systems, phone systems, and active directory.· Advanced Knowledge of LAN/WAN configurations and topologies· Familiarity with troubleshooting networking equipment and TCP/IP· Outside the box diagnosis skills of technical issues· Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly· Attention to detail· Technical awareness: ability to match resources to technical issues appropriately· Service awareness of all organization’s key IT services for which support is being provided· Understanding of support tools, techniques, and how technology is used to provide IT service· Ability to work alone with minimal supervision as well as in a dynamic team environment· Self-motivated with the ability to work in a fast moving, sometimes high stress environment· Leadership skills with a sense of responsibility towards mentoring peersPreferred Qualifications:Minimum Bachelors Degree3+ Years in a Sales, Customer Service or BSA role supporting technologyWorking knowledge of Network FundamentalsExceptional presentation skillsStrong attention to detail and accuracyTechno-Functional or Business Systems Analysis SkillsExcellent documentation and proposal writing abilitiesBenefits:1. Salary is competitive with the Industry and commensurate with experience.2. Health insurance, Dental Insurance, Short Term Disability and Long Term Disability coverage following the completion of 90 days of employment.3. 401(k) pension plan, subject to plan terms (1 year vesting followed by enrollment on the closer of January 1 or July 1 of the corresponding year).4. 9 Company-paid holidays, including New Year’s Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Columbus Day, Thanksgiving Day, Friday after Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day.After your start date you will receive a Benefits Summary that provides detailed information concerning our total compensation program in effect as of your expected start date.Company Overview:MERIT (MERIT ) was founded in 1982 to be the Single-Source IT Communications Partner for businesses in Hampton Roads. MERIT manages computer systems and networks, provides VOIP Phone Systems, high speed internet connections, and is one of the highest ranked, independent MSPs in Virginia. We have a commitment to extraordinary service, which we believe is essential to achieve long term success. With over 100 years of combined experience in telecommunications, internet, wireless and information technology, MERIT ’s leadership team has built a dynamic company that emphasizes people and service as the foundations for long-term business success. With headquarters in Chesapeake, VA MERIT is a privately held company serving over 120 business clients.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per yearBenefits: Flexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time off Schedule: Day shiftMonday to Friday Work Location: In person

title: PE Sr. Electrical Engineer/Project Manager
company: Electronic Systems, Inc. - A Xerox Company
description: Our client, a well-known Engineering firm in Virginia Beach, VA specializing in mechanical, electrical, plumbing, technology and fire protection engineering services is seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer/Project Manager. In this role, the Senior Electrical Engineer/Project Manager will work closely with clients, team partners, and fellow staff to produce engineering drawings and documents. Responsibilities:Project and client management, overseeing of mechanical design execution.Prepare proposals for various clients as either the lead A/E or sub-consultant.Administer project contracts, including invoicing and resource management.Coordinates with company team leads for planning use of resources and completing projects within budgeted times. Supervise and mentor staff, and self-perform the following:Electrical system analysis, including normal and back-up power systems, lighting systems, and fire alarm systems.Preparation of construction documents for power distribution systems, lighting systems, and fire alarm system.Coordinate with in-house and subconsultant specialists for electrical support of varying low-voltage systems, such as technology, security, controls, etc.Coordinate with other trades, such as architects, mechanical and plumbing engineers and others for equipment power and control needs and sizing electrical distribution.Perform design calculations of electrical loads to size and select distribution equipment.Develop electrical systems one-line diagrams.Perform field verification of existing systems for renovation projects.Write and edit specifications to reflect the project requirements.Communication with manufacturer representatives to determine solutions for specific applications.Prepare design deliverables for various owner required submittals, i.e., SD, DD, CD level documents.Perform project construction administration including response to RFI’s, review of submittals, preparation of bulletins, review of contactor change orders, field visits and punch trips for installation verification.Review designs prepared by others as part of AEC’s QA/QC process.Attend meetings with clients, authorities having jurisdiction, and other professionals as projects require.Conduct business development activities, participating in various trade organizations, and preparing or assisting with presentations.Qualifications:10 - 15 years of electrical design and project management in consulting engineering.Working knowledge of design and analysis software such as Revit, AutoCAD, SKM, ETAP, Easypower.Good knowledge of National Electrical Code (NEC), State Energy Code, NFPA guidelines, and FGI guidelines.Experience with electrical system studies such as short circuit, over-current device coordination, and Arc Flash Hazard analysis per NPFA 70E.Ability to instruct staff in project communications, and client management.Proficient knowledge of standard construction practices and the ability to work with contractors to address construction issues.Ability to work and manage several project teams concurrently.Experience in designing Healthcare, Commercial, Public Sector, Education, and/or Institutional projects.Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering Preferred.PE License preferred.RCDD preferred. Additional Experience/Skills Desired:Certifications for; Outside Plan Designer (OSP), Electronic Security Specialist (ESS), Certified Technology Specialist – Designer (CTS-D) a plus.High Performance & Sustainable Building Design Economic AnalysisCertified Commissioning Authority/Agent (CxA)Cost Estimating (MCACES, SUCCESS, TRACES and/or RS Means COSTWORKS)Design-Build project delivery methodVirginia Department of General Services (DGS), Division of Engineering & Buildings (DEB), Construction andProfessional Services Manual (CPSM) training and certification a plus.Our client offers competitive salaries with performance-based bonuses, career advancement opportunities, comprehensive health benefits, paid time off and holidays, and retirement saving options. The benefits package includes health (with FSA and HSA options), dental, vision, and life insurance. Retirement savings options include 401k with company match and ESOP contributions. Other benefits include tuition support, professional membership support, bonuses for publication and teaching, and more. AEC offers flexible work schedules and hybrid options to accommodate our employee's personal schedules and help with work/life balance.

title: FLUID POWER ENGINEER
description: Some see the railway as transportation, while at Plasser American we see it as transformation. The story of how steel tracks turned the American promise into American progress and forged a trusted pathway to the possibilities of the future. It’s a story that continues today, an American legacy unfolding mile by mile. There is a lot riding on those tracks and we know that support, quality and know-how are all important aspects in staying on track.That’s why the Plasser American tradition begins with a promise. A promise to do things right. An unapologetic commitment to quality that makes us the longtime trusted leader in cutting edge American made innovations for the North American railway. It’s a promise to see things differently to turn ordinary steel into safer passages. To be a partner that you can count on to engineer solutions for the challenges of today and for the opportunities of tomorrow. From research and design, expert manufacturing and delivering unapparelled services, our customers trust us to keep them ahead of the curve.Progress is about more than getting from Point A to Point B. It’s knowing you have a trusted foundation to move you forward toward new possibilities waiting around the corner. Join Plasser American to become part of our team forging ahead towards new opportunities in railway maintenance. The railway is a path to the future, choose this path and apply today.General Scope: Fluid Power Engineer to support Engineering group. Fluid power engineer applies fluid power theory and related knowledge to design, test and troubleshoot operational mobile hydraulic systems and applications.Position Summary:Applies knowledge of engineering principles to design products used on maintenance of way equipment for the railroad industry.Solid knowledge and understanding of fundamental and advanced Fluid power principles and ability to apply knowledge in the design of complex hydraulic/pneumatic circuits in an OEM environment.Complete fluid power systems experience with all levels of hydraulic/pneumatic components from pumps, motors, valves to actuators.Significant experience in mobile/construction equipment hydraulic/pneumatic system design, and development.Study, research and analyze customer specifications, manuals and other data to assist in creating machine work orders.Compiles and analyzes operational, test, and research data to establish performance standards for newly designed or modified equipment or product.Plans, schedules and coordinates the preparation of hydraulic/pneumatic projects to meet deadlines.Sizing and selecting hydraulic and pneumatic components and provide specifications to Planning/Purchasing department.Uses EPLAN Fluid for the automated design and documentation of circuits in fluid power installations in hydraulics, pneumatics, cooling and lubrication complying with current standards such as ISO 1219.Ability to systematically solve hydraulic/pneumatic related problems and perform root cause analysis.Supervise the detailed design and drafting of the hydraulic/pneumatic components and installation drawings with cad designers.Keeps informed of new methods and practices in system designs and components.Plans and develops experimental test programs.Analyzes test data and reports to determine if design meets functional and performance specifications.May require some traveling to customer job site to evaluate problems and report back to management with findings.Strong leadership and project management skills and self-starter.Good organizational skills, and ability to independently manage multiple and conflicting priorities.Ability to interact with various department and provide support to product line, purchasing, production, technical support and sales support.Education: As a minimum require a Bachelor's Degree in an engineering field with at least 5-7 years of experience in the field of mobile hydraulic design or a Master’s Degree with a minimum of 3-years of experience. Experience to consist of relevant product design or development of hydraulic components or motion control systems.Certified fluid power hydraulic specialist (CFPS), NFPA (National Fluid Power Association) or other fluid power organizations certificate is required.In addition to having the technical qualifications, a fluid power engineer must be a good team player with strong communication and problem-solving skills. The individual must be able to think practically and authoritatively, able to accommodate the company's deadlines, budget, and other resources to make informed decisions for their projects.Knowledge: Incumbent must have proficient knowledge in the following areas:Knowledge of Engineering.Skills: Incumbent must demonstrate or participate in internal/external training programs to obtain the following skills:Knowledge of the current ISO and ANSI (Y14) standards.Working knowledge of the metric system and geometric dimensioning and tolerance.Familiar with weldments, and machining operation.Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents.Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.Ability to write articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format.EIT certification will be considered as a PLUS.Motivated and self-starter with the ability to work under deadlines.Ability to apply mathematical concepts such as Calculus and modern Algebra.Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.AREMA, AAR, S.A.E. membership helpful but not required.  Applicable Technical Competencies: Incumbent must have working knowledge and demonstrated abilities utilizing mechanical knowledge: Specific applications combined with knowledge competencies are as follows: Rating Level: 1-5 (1= minimum 5= Maximum)ApplicationRequired Level of proficiencyPreferred Level of proficiencyAutodesk Vault Professional 20154 - Full Proficiency5 - Expert ProficiencyInventor Professional 20154 - Full Proficiency5 - Expert ProficiencyAutoCAD 20154 - Full Proficiency5 - Expert ProficiencyMicrosoft Outlook3 - Working Proficiency3 - Working ProficiencyDesign Review3 - Working Proficiency4 - Full ProficiencyMicrosoft Excel4 – Full Proficiency5 - Expert ProficiencyMicrosoft Word4 - Full Proficiency4 - Full ProficiencyJIRA & Confluence3 - Working Proficiency4 - Full ProficiencyE-PLAN3 - Working Proficiency4 - Full ProficiencyAutomation Studio4 - Full Proficiency5 - Expert ProficiencyPersonal Attributes: Incumbent must maintain strict confidentiality in performing the duties of a Fluid Power Engineer. The incumbent must also demonstrate the following personal attributes:Be honest and trustworthyBe respectfulPossess cultural awareness and sensitivityBe flexibleDemonstrate sound work ethicsBenefits:Accrue 80 Hours of Paid Time Off during your first year of employment10 Paid Holidays per year401(k) match of $0.50 for every $1.00 you contribute up to 6% of your salaryYou may receive a merit bonus after completion of the audit at the end of the fiscal yearTuition ReimbursementFree Short and Long Term Disability after 90 days of employmentFree Life Insurance – 2 times your annual salaryCompany EventsFree employee medical and dental coverage. – valued at $7,500.00About Plasser American: As part of the Plasser family brand, which is the largest Maintenance of Way equipment provider in the world, PAC is a rapidly growing provider of railway equipment in North America. Continuing for the next few years, PAC will continue to make significant investments in the North American Market including a new office building and a substantial addition to our manufacturing facility. PAC is making the needed investments to continue its growth trajectory for many years to come. The next several years will be an exciting time of transformation. We look to the future to enhance our team and achieve our goals.PI233352586

title: Systems Administrator

Responsibilities will include:Execute system administrator responsibilities for NU, NR, and NS CIS systems within the CSU AOR.Perform troubleshooting of server/client hardware and software, ensuring resolution of issues.Manage and update the VMware Virtual Environment.Analyze and implement Microsoft Active Directory changes to align with user and operational requirements.Review and update Microsoft & Linux policies for system optimization and security enhancement.Implement and test new software versions and patches.Utilize PowerShell commands and scripts for the automation of system administration tasks.Assist in fault resolution, documenting actions following Incident Management procedures.Develop and maintain Standard Operating Procedures for routine system administration tasks.Adhere to EMSEC and Cyber Security policies/standards.Provide regular status updates for assigned requests using ITSM Service Desk Software.Conduct follow-ups with users upon completion of requests prior to closure.Collaborate with other work sections within the Service Operations Branch to support mission requirements.Lead the ITIL Problem Management process, contributing to Incident Management, Change Management, and Continuous Service Improvement.Develop and maintain Disaster Response Plans (DRPs) for assigned systems, conducting regular testing and execution in line with the overarching CSU DRP.Ability to lift 25lbs unassisted. title: Systems Engineer
description: Cybrex is in the process of bidding a new Cyber/IT Services Proposal and is sourcing for potential staff. This position is one of many where we are accepting applications, doing interviews and making contingent employment offers with negotiated salary amounts. Upon a win the Contingent offer would become a permanent offer at the previously agreed upon salary. Positions are located in the Hampton Roads area and would follow the particular bases COVID protocols which might mean working remotely or on-site. It could also mean that at some time in the future any remote work would move to the activity you would be supporting. In several of these positions there are multiple experience levels required, which are noted below with any educational or experience requirements so please review position descriptions carefully, many positions will require certification under the Cyber Security Work Force (CSWF) program certification criteria specified in DoD 8570.01-M, in some cases they are noted in the position description in others the government has not yet made that determination, once known this information will be communicated to selected candidates, it would be safe to assume that at a minimum an IAT (Information Assurance Technical) Level II certification as specified in DoD 8570.01-M would be required:Systems Engineer II -At least 4 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with a variety of the fields concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. May lead and direct the work of others. Performs a variety of complex project tasks applied to specialized technology problems. Tasks involve integration of electronic processes or methodologies to resolve total system problems or technology problems. Applies analytical and systematic approaches in the resolution of problems of work flow, organization, and planning. Directs and assists system engineers in the application of system engineering principles to the solution of secure systems design problems. Expert knowledge of LANs, WANs, VPNs, routers, firewalls, network protocols, and other security and network operations and monitoring, vulnerability analysis, PKI, data encryption, key management, data warehousing, and data mining capabilities. Systems Engineer III - Bachelors Degree in STEM and at least 7 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with a variety of the fields concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals and independently performs a wide variety of complicated tasks. May provide consultation on complex projects and is considered to be the top level contributor/specialist. May lead and direct the work of others. Performs a variety of complex project tasks applied to specialized technology problems. Tasks involve integration of electronic processes or methodologies to resolve total system problems or technology problems. Applies analytical and systematic approaches in the resolution of problems of work flow, organization, and planning. Directs and assists system engineers in the application of system engineering principles to the solution of secure systems design problems. Expert knowledge of LANs, WANs, VPNs, routers, firewalls, network protocols, and other security and network operations and monitoring, vulnerability analysis, PKI, data encryption, key management, data warehousing, and data mining capabilities.

title: Audio-Visual Systems Programmer
description: JOB POSTINGAudio-Visual Systems Programmer VIcom - Virginia Integrated Communication – Virginia BeachDepartment: AV - Virginia BeachReports to: Audio-Visual Integration/Service ManagerWe are seeking an experienced professional Audio-Visual Systems Programmer responsible for the programming, testing and support of complex audio-visual systems for control, audio DSP and other equipment/software related configurations. The successful candidate will have a history of designing clean and functional program interfaces that allow for the best user experience for performance and control of complex systems. This position will provide support for remote office/in-office pre-stage system testing/configuration, as well as customer remote and onsite testing/commissioning support in a variety of customer environments.Employee Owned. Customer Focused. VIcom is an industry leader dedicated to providing customers with complete integrated solutions and services through every outlet from - initial planning, consultation, design, integration, and implementation. Our innovative solutions allow organizations to integrate voice, video, data, and security communications to operate more efficiently and effectively with no compromise in quality or reliability.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Work with Solution Engineer team and customer to gather system program functionality requirements and preferences.Programs Crestron, Q-Sys, Extron, and RTI systems.Programs Audio DSP with Biamp, Q-SYS and other systems.Performs thorough testing and commissioning of all systems both in office and onsite.Supervises in-house rack resting and equipment setup for assigned projects.Provides remote support to Technicians and Field Engineers for integration of systems.Performs remote and onsite service support as needed for completed integrated systems as part of our ongoing Technology Management Support Plans.Coordinates with Engineer, Integration Manager, and Project Manager on system scope and design.Create user guides for customer system operation and provide end user training.Additional Duties and Responsibilities:Continually work to improve customer service perception, and satisfaction.Document internal processes and procedures related to duties and responsibilities.Capture configurations and programs created within our system.Enter time and expenses as they occur.Closes jobs in conjunction with Project Manager.Support of creating technical standards, process/procedures.Complete training programs and gain certifications as required.All other duties and or responsibilities as assigned by supervisor.Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities Required:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Crestron/Extron/Q-SYS, Poly, Biamp, Shure, Vaddio, Zoom, Teams etc... Manufacturer-Software Experience/Training.CTS certification.Ability to read and understand project drawings and schematics, engineering notes, and operation manuals.PC literacy to include Microsoft Office applications, MAC experience helpful.Experience performing each of the job responsibilities outlined above in an associated industry.Demonstrate effective communication skills using tact and courtesy along with the ability to manage pressure sensitive situations.Demonstrated ability to work without direct supervision.Working knowledge of networking fundamentals such as TCP/IP addressing, firewalls, routers, VPN and Vlan setup in an AV/IT environment.Good interpersonal and time management skills.Must be detail oriented, have multi-tasking abilities, and handle tight, high stress deadlines. Candidates must be able to work multiple shifts given including days, evenings, overtime, and some weekends based on project deadlines.Ability for some travel to complete assignments.Professional presentation and demeanor.3 to 5 years+ in Audio-Visual system field installation and integration.3 to 5 years+ in Audio-Visual Systems programming of Crestron and other top control systems, DSP Audio etc...High school diploma or equivalency required / College degree in technology a plus.Have/maintain a clean driving record and valid driver’s license.Ability to pass a criminal background check.Excellent benefits package including health insurance, 401K savings and Employee Stock Ownership Program.   VIcom is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Network Security Engineer
description: ***THIS POSITION REQUIRES AN ACTIVE "SECRET" CLEARANCE --- U.S. CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED***Imagine One is currently seeking qualified Network Security Engineer III individuals to join our team to provide Network Security Engineering Support to Naval Surface Warfare Center Dahlgren Division, Dam Neck who supports the Program Executive Office Unmanned and Small Combatants (PEO) providing cybersecurity engineering support, cybersecurity requirements Software Support Activity support for the Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) class Environment (TSCE) networks, LCS Afloat Sites for PMS 501 (New Construction), Service), and IWS80 Littoral Combat Ships( LCS). Work will be on-site at Naval Air Station Oceana Dam Neck, Virginia Beach, Virginia with 20%-30% travel potential Marinette, Wisconsin; Jacksonville, FL; San Diego, CA.The Network Security Engineer III will provide ongoing network support, addresses availability issues, overcome performance problems, and provide overall level 2 support. Designs, installs, maintains and coordinates the use of network systems. Evaluates hardware and software and peripheral equipment for large, complex networks to include the following responsibilities:Responsibilities for Network Security Engineer III:The Network Security Engineer III would serve as a Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) Network Security Engineer at NSWCDD DNA. The Network Security Engineer III will provide network-engineering support to pre-delivery and in-service LCS ships. The selectee will serve within a team of engineers for the LCS Total Ships Computing Environment (TSCE) core business network and provide support for the LCS Software Support Agent (SSA). He/she will perform network engineering, integration, evaluation and testing within the LCS TSCE core business network. He/she will perform networks security updates upgrades to ensure the security and integrity of the TSCE network. Network Security Engineer III will analyze, troubleshoot and resolve issues with the LCS TSCE infrastructure including devices such as routers, switches, and firewalls. The Network Security Engineer III will perform all duties associated for support, maintenance, performance and uptime of the LCS TSCE core infrastructure to include as follows:Provide network security engineering support to PMS 501/505 and IWS80 for implementation of Cybersecurity Ships Change Documents (SCDs) and Engineering Change Proposal (ECPs).Provide engineering and network architecture expertise for pre-delivery/in-service ships for integration and modernization efforts.Perform security/vulnerability assessments using DoD provided tools; reporting results to the lead cybersecurity system engineer.Provide oversight for the day-to-day management and maintenance of the LCS core network infrastructure.Perform firewall and network device support for the TSCE core infrastructure.Oversee in the deployment of switches, routers, firewalls, and storage devices from multiple vendors.Support and interact with the network cybersecurity engineers, system administrators, and system engineers to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of systems, networks, and data.Assist with network engineering executing activities such as the design, implementation, installation, configuration, maintenance, integration, and analysis.Assist in the management and maintenance of lab facilities.Apply software patches and patch sets during maintenance windowsIncludes operating system (OS) patches released from DISA’s patch repository website.Upgrade software.Conduct regression testing Required QualificationsRequires five (5) years with BS/BA or minimum zero (0) to two (2) years with MS/MA/MBA or eight to ten (8 to 10) years with no degree.Minimum certification as 461 at the Intermediate level per DoDD 8140.01, or successorInformation Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II certificationMinimum of five (5) years’ experience in Network EngineeringDemonstrated experience with Windows OS and Linux OSDemonstrated experience with performing STIG implementationDemonstrated experience performing vulnerability assessments with the Assured Compliance Assessment Solution toolMust have hands-on technical experience in the following areas:Network Routing ProtocolsCisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) FirewallsExtensive experience with Access Control Lists (ACLs)Experience with Cisco security devices focusing on Identity Services Engine (ISE), Web Security Appliance (WSA) and Email Security Appliance (ESA)Demonstrated experience troubleshooting network connectivity issuesMust have experience in Network Security to include the design, implementation, configuration, and enforcement of security controls on network, hardware, and software components and devicesExperience with the implementation of cybersecurity and Information Assurance (IA) boundary defense techniques and various IA-enabled appliances (firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), Intrusion Prevention System (IPS), switches/routersKnowledge of computing and networking vulnerabilities, attack methods and latest detection methodsExcellent ability to communicate effectively orally and in writingPreferred Qualifications:Served on a LCS platformWindows Server upgrade experienceHBSS knowledge is a plusExperience utilizing packet analyzer tools such as Wireshark and tcpdumpHyper-V or VMware experience is a plusAlcatel operating system experience is a plusSecurity Requirements:U.S. Citizenship required.Candidate must have an ACTIVE SECRET clearance (with TS/SCI eligibility)Imagine One offers a full package of benefits and competitive salary, excellent group medical, vision and dental programs. 401K savings plan; $4K annual tuition reimbursement ($5K if pursuing Master’s degree); employee training, development and education programs; profit sharing; advancement opportunities; and much more! ISO 9001:2015, ISO 20000-1:2018, ISO 27001:2013CMMI Development Level 3An Employee-Owned BusinessEEO/AA Employer. Protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities encouraged to apply.

title: Audio Visual VTC Engineer - Virginia Beach, Va
description: iSoft Solutions (iSoft) is an industry leader dedicated to providing Government customers with turnkey integrated solutions and services through every outlet from - initial planning, consultation, design, integration, implementation and post-install support. iSoft is currently seeking a Professional Services Engineer (PSE) to support the continued growth of our Audio Visual – Network Technology group headquartered out of Virginia Beach, VA. Recent technical experience is REQUIRED; experience in the Federal Government sector is strongly preferred. Project / account coverage may span the continental U.S. with a focus in Southeastern Virginia, and the Mid-Atlantic region (VA / NC / MD / DC). A Govt Security Clearance is preferred. The ability to obtain a US Government Security Clearance is required (i.e., background check).As a PSE, you must exemplify exceptional communication, organization, and leadership skills with strong technical experience in the integration of audiovisual, video conferencing and closely related technologies to support the delivery of turn-key solutions. Duties of your position include but are not limited to the below. Other duties may be assigned as needed to support the overall mission of iSoft or service delivery customer requirements.Core Responsibilities:Assist the Project Manager to schedule, manage, and coordinate the available labor, materials, tools, equipment, transportation, and technical expertise for a successfully implemented AV/VTC project.Collaborate with the Service Manager and Logistics & Service Administrator regarding the overall planning and allocation of resources for upcoming projects.Conduct internal and external (customer site) kick-off meetings.Conduct internal project recap meetings.Review engineered drawings and statements of work prior to project implementation, and collaborate with Engineering on any questions, considerations and potential changes prior to start of project.Serve as back-end support to technicians for addressing project questions and concerns and provide escalated technical support on site as needed.Provide software configuration and programming functions and support (ie. VTC, DSP, control system programming).Responsible for testing and commissioning of systems.Perform QA/QC checks onsite and provide constructive feedback / guidance to technician crews.Successfully plan, implement, test, train, and close audiovisual and VTC projects within the budgeted timeline provided. Assist in obtaining customer sign-off at completion.Occasionally perform pre-engineering site surveys and provide the in-house dedicated engineering team with all necessary information to effectively design A/V solutions for the end user.Maintain and update technical and project documentation to reflect every aspect of the project’s progress.Support both new project installations as well as maintenance/service requirements as required.Manage projects on-site while overseeing and, at times, participating in the physical installation of the following (but not limited to): large displays, video walls, projectors and screens, Smart boards, speakers, amplifiers, audio/video switchers, mixers, DSP’s, microphones, control systems, and video conferencing units.Read and interpret blue prints, drawings and schematics.Mark up AV design drawings and documents to reflect actual field (installed) conditions for the purpose of accurate as-built development.Assist in tracking equipment inventory, recording serial numbers, and delivering equipment.Work in varied conditions including outdoor environments and confined spaces. Erect and work on scaffolding, tall ladders and motorized lifts.Oversee the daily activities of projects and technician crews assigned to multiple concurrent jobs as well as provide the iSoft Service Manager and Customer liaison with all necessary updates throughout project at a frequency determined by your supervisor.Conduct work in compliance with national, state and local OSHA electrical and safety codes; telecommunications industry standards; materials manufacturer specifications; and customer requirements.Be available to travel for out of town projects for extended periods of time.Be flexible for working off-hours and overtime as required by project deadlines, including nights and weekends on a limited basis.Base Qualifications and Requirements:High School Diploma or equivalent.One year college level basic electrical/electronic study or completion of formal military basic electrical/electronic training.At least five years of dedicated Audio Visual experience.Audio DSP programming experience or training preferred.Control system programming experience or training preferred (Crestron, Extron, AMX).Needs to be Self-sufficient, self-motivated, organized, reliable, with excellent work ethics.Needs to be detail oriented, have multi-tasking abilities and handle tight deadlines and challenging customer or job environments.Audiovisual/videoconferencing manufacturer experience and training, certifications a plus.Proficient in Microsoft Office.CTS Certification required.Physical condition to perform job duties including seeing/hearing; feeling/handling/reaching; bending / crouching / squatting / kneeling / pushing / pulling / lifting / carrying weights in excess of 70 pounds (heavy work); tolerance for prolonged walking or standing on various surfaces and/or work on ladders or aerial lifts.Work methods must be in compliance with national, state and local electrical and safety codes; telecommunications industry standards; materials manufacturer specifications; and customer requirements.Currently hold Secret Clearance or have eligibility to immediately attain a Security Clearance to support our DoD clients.This is a leadership role – soft skills for interacting with co-workers and customer is an absolute must have.

title: Controls Engineer
description: Join us for an exciting career with a well-established Controls and Data Systems Integrator as a Controls Engineer in the Chesapeake, Va. area. This person will be responsible for developing manufacturing automation projects for Fortune 500 Companies utilizing the latest in automation technologies. Controls Engineers are given the opportunity to work on projects from the initial planning stages to field installation and commissioning. Controls Engineer Responsibilities include:· Design automation control systems.· Equipment and materials specification including PLCs, automation and control instrumentation· Program Human Interface systems via Wonderware, Factorytalk, Siemens HMI products.· Proficient in programming PLC's, Rockwell, Siemens, GE, Modicon, etc.· Documenting project issues/conditions and maintaining detailed records· Submitting Complete Project manuals.· Manage scheduling, updates with clients and detailed logs Controls Engineer Requirements:· 2-4 years experience as a Controls Engineer· Good working knowledge of control and automation systems, PLCs and other related controls.· Knowledge of NEC, ISA standards and recommendations· Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Engineering Technology (Preferred)· Must be a U.S. citizen for this project position
